page.title: 06FARMING IN THE COLYTON AREA
page.content: In the Colyton area, farming is one of the main occupations of men, women and children. Nowadays they use big machinery like silagers for making silage, combine harvesters for cutting corn and bailers for bailing grass into bails. New technology is being used for milking, rearing cattle and pigs. The land is also used to grow grass for silage and hay, and corn is grown for animals and sometimes used as seed for the next year. Cows and sheep are mainly reared around this area. Shiphay Farm milk cows which is used to produce cheese and butter from the spare milk. Calves are reared which are kept until they are old enough to be milked. Other farms rear beef cattle or pigs which are fattened and sold. Sheep are reared and then killed for their meat, and their wool.
